document.docAuthor: Cunha, Andressa Maria, Terossi, Mariana, Mantelatto, Fernando L. & Almeida, Alexandre O.
document.masterDocTitle: Morphological and molecular analyses support the amphi-Atlantic distribution and taxonomic status of the snapping shrimp Alpheus intrinsecus Spence Bate, 1888 (Crustacea: Decapoda: Alpheidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Morphological and molecular analyses support the amphi-Atlantic distribution and taxonomic status of the snapping shrimp Alpheus intrinsecus Spence Bate, 1888 (Crustacea: Decapoda: Alpheidae)

bibRefCitation.author: Spence Bate
bibRefCitation.refString: Spence Bate, C. S. (1888) Report on the Crustacea Macrura dredged by H. M. S. Challenger during the years 1873 - 76. In: The voyage of H. M. S. Challenger. Zoology. Vol. 24. Eyre & Spottiswoode, London, pp. i-xi, 1 - 942, pls. 1 - 157 (separate volume).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Alpheus intrinseccus Luederwaldt 1919 , p. 430
; 1929 , p. 52 (erroneous spelling).

Crangon intrinsecus Schmitt 1926 , p. 23
.

Type material.
Not examined (deposited in the Natural History Museum , London , England [ NHMUK 1888.22 ])
.

Colour in life. A photograph of the colour pattern of a live specimen from Bahia , Brazil , was provided by
Santos et al. (2012)
.

Type locality.
Off Salvador , Bahia , Brazil
.

Ecology. Mud, clay, sand, sand with gorgonians,
Halodule
meadows, coarse sand with shells, in calcareous algae, coral gravel and crevices; pieces of decaying wood; depth range:
0 to 40 m
. ( Christoffersen 1979 ;
Almeida et al. 2006
;
Santos et al. 2012
, this study).
Measurements. Largest specimen analyzed: male, CL: 13.48 mm (UESC 1573); smallest specimen analyzed: female, CL: 2.13 mm (RMNH.Crus.D.21736).

Mouthparts typical for
Alpheus
( Figs. 1 D–I); mandible with palp; incisive process robust, with eight or nine teeth distally rounded; molar process robust ( Fig. 1D ); first and second maxilliped as illustrated, not speciesspecific; third maxilliped robust, longer than antennular peduncle and carpocerite when extended; pleurobranchia absent at base; coxa with lateral plate, slightly truncated distally; antepenultimate segment of endopod narrow, not flat, with rough ventral margin and few setae; penultimate segment approximately half length of last segment; lateral margin slightly rough; last segment tapering distally, with lateral margin slightly rough and very long setae; exopod of third maxilliped not reaching distal end of endopodal penultimate segment, with long, flexible setae on posterior margin (Fig. 11).

Variation. There was no consistent morphological variation in the characters analyzed for all western and eastern Atlantic specimens. The morphological analysis showed neither significant variation between sexes nor during ontogeny.
